There is an exciting opportunity for an experienced Senior Developer to join my client in Bridgend. They’re in the process of transitioning from a client project based business model to an internal product driven business, which you'll have the opportunity to be at the heart of.

I am looking for a Senior Developer with 3+ years’ relevant experience and the following core skills:
  • HTML/CSS/JS
  • Experience of Object-oriented PHP in a production environment
  • JavaScript framework(s) – Jquery, Angular, React
  • Databases such as MySQL/MSSQL/Postgres
  • Understanding of LAN/WAN
Desirable skills are:
  • Java/Android in a production environment
  • PHP frameworks such as CakePHP, Laravel ect.
  • GIT.SVN software
Why Apply?
  • Brand new offices in a great location, with train station 5 minute walk away.
  • Remote & Flexible working.
  • State of the art infrastructure.
  • Travel to work scheme
  • Competitive Salary
  • Choice of hardware and tech
  • Monthly free lunch club
  • Shower facilities
  • A fun-filled working environment.
  • Exposure to the latest technologies and training in these technologies.
Interviews have started already please apply by Wednesday 14 th to be considered for the role.

If you are a self-motivated individual who is keen to develop existing knowledge whilst being part of a fun growing team give me a ring on 01179107984.

Senior Software Developer – Bridgend - £28,000 – £33,000
Bridgend
Permanent
£28,000 - £33,000 a year

items.title: eCommerce PHP Web Developer: On-site or Remote position
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=26, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
We are looking for an experienced, dynamic and collaborative Web Developer that will work closely with the Marketing and IT teams to identify and prioritize opportunities to enhance the pc/nametag website. We are open to this position being either on-site or remote.

Because we recruit the most talented people with proven track records, pc/nametag, Inc. continues to experience unprecedented growth while fostering a culture that values and rewards the high-quality work of each employee. We take great stock in individuals who bring ideas to the table while also working collaboratively toward a well-executed plan, one that turns possibilities into highly successful results.

In this new role you will be responsible for the technical development of the pc/nametag website-providing full cycle project leadership including architecture, database design/programming and Magento development, while building site layouts and UI elements.

At pc/nametag each employee is valued. Customer service is not only vital to keeping our customers happy, but for our employees as well. We enjoy a variety of soft perks, some of our favorites are weekly catered lunches, the yearly UW Badger football game and the variety of holiday celebrations like Mardi Gras and Halloween - all while working together to successfully grow pc/nametag®.

Responsibilities:
  • • Identify technical needs and gather specifications and requirements for efficient updates
  • • Write documented, quality code using best development practices that can undergo extensive testing
  • • Responsible for deploying, maintaining, and scaling the pc/nametag website
  • • Integrate data from SQL databases and other back-end services.
  • • Keep up with industry trends and apply them into operations and activities when necessary

Requirements:
  • • Associates degree in Computer Science, MIS, related field; or 5 years of equivalent work experience
  • • Minimum of 3 to 5 years of PHP experience
  • • 7 years of web development experience
  • • Strong grasp of git version control
  • • Experience with running applications in a continuous integration environment
  • • Regression and unit testing with PHPUnit
  • • Familiarity with developing and consuming REST and SOAP APIs
  • • Must be comfortable working on complex Linux systems for administration and debugging as needed
  • • Ability to convert business needs into implemented features
  • • Analyze, design, code, debug, test, document, deploy and provide ongoing support for web applications, owning the entire feature-request to deployment pipeline.
  • • Experience administering LAMP-stack applications in a highly-available cluster.

What we offer:

pc/nametag® operates within the Avery® North America division of CCL Industries Inc., a world leader in specialty label and packaging solutions for global corporations, small businesses and consumers. Here in Verona, WI, we feature the best of both worlds-the culture of a 80-employee community backed by the strength and success of a growing global network. Our employees are our greatest asset, and we make sure they know it. We offer:
  • • Excellent compensation commensurate with experience
  • • Comprehensive benefit package including 401K, health, dental and more
  • • Mid-sized company culture that values individual contribution
  • • Many "soft perks" such as catered lunches during our busy season, outings, free DVD/Blu-ray library, etc.
To learn more about our company, visit our website at . Please email your resume to . Please reference Web Developer in the subject line. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and provide a drug-free workplace.

items.title: Full Stack Drupal Developer (US-based telecommute position) - Alpharetta
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=53, embedded=0, frontend=19}
items.content:
About Us

Mediacurrent is a digital agency that specializes its focus and outstanding reputation in Drupal. We have a proven track record of helping some of the most recognizable brands (The Weather Channel, WWE), universities (Harvard, LSU) and organizations (Turner) in the world adopt and grow with an open-source software strategy. We pursue open-source principles and contributing back to the Drupal community giving you an opportunity to challenge and stretch your mind on a daily basis.

We're a company founded on building a close knit company culture with a fully remote team. Mediacurrent keeps our remote team close focusing on our culture with an annual company retreat, weekly knowledge shares, 9/80 flexible schedule, lunch and learns and virtual/in-person meetups.

At Mediacurrent we invest heavily in our team providing benefits such as IRA matching, continuing education reimbursement and speaking bonuses.

About You

Do you have a passion for open source technologies, Drupal and building innovative web systems? Do you see the big picture of a Drupal project? Ready to ditch the commute and work from wherever is comfortable to you? Mediacurrent is looking for a developer like yourself to choose our team.

Qualifications

  • Ability to write and contribute modules to creatively solve client problems
  • Proficient writing skills to communicate with clients including site architecture documentation
  • Proven 2+ year track record of working with Drupal sites
  • Familiarity with Git and Drupal development technologies such as Drush, Features and Panels
  • Knowledge of Drupal-adjunct technologies such as the LAMP platform, HTML5, CSS3, SASS jQuery/JavaScript a plus
  • Passionate about Drupal community involvement and open-source

    • This is a telecommute position.

    Equal Employment Opportunity

    Mediacurrent provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Mediacurrent complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company operates or?employees reside. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

items.title: Software Engineer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=9, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=14, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=2, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=18, embedded=0, frontend=9}
items.content:
Software Engineer

is a fast-growing online-only flower delivery service with a competitive edge. Since launching in 2014, we have become an iconic European flower brand with our innovative business model. Our Amsterdam HQ is home to a diverse team of 80+ high-tech and highly-creative people and growing. 

We're looking for a driven Medior Software Engineer to join us. As part of bloomon’s Product and Engineering team, you’ll build the software that powers our business. From scaling up our subscription platform to meet a 10x increase in volume and complexity to forecasting the number of Paradisaeidae needed for next month’s delivery — you’d be surprised at the amount of tech in flowers!

What you can expect

  • Your focus is to shape our technical platform and engineering culture as we grow
  • Capitalising on opportunities that increase reliability, performance, and real-life efficiency.
  • Structure and a tight schedule suit you, but you’re happy to step outside the box to solve operational problems.
  • Diligence about improving the codebase
  • Working in a team to find the best trade-offs between quality, speed, and scope.
  • Working across a variety of projects, including daily operations, improving the product, innovating the core subscription platform and algorithms
  • Balancing creative engineering with high quality and a customer focus
  • Enhancing the processes that make an effective team: writing good tests, giving and receiving code reviews, writing clear documentation, holding retrospectives, etc.
  • Working alongside other developers, product designers, product owners and a broader team of supply chain experts, brand creatives and stylists

About you 

  • A Bachelor Degree or higher in Computer Science or a related technical field
  • At least 3 years’ professional experience in software development
  • Strong experience in at least 1 programming/scripting languages like PHP, Python, Ruby, Javascript…
  • Experienced with (relational) databases like Postgresql and MySQL
  • You’re experienced in working in an agile environment
  • You have good communication skills and are a team player
  • Familiarity with DevOps
  • Experience with part of our current tech stack: 
    • PHP, Laravel
    • React, Node.js
    • Python, Pandas
    • Google Cloud, Kubernetes, Docker
  • You live in the Netherlands
  • Fluent in English. Dutch is a bonus

What we offer

  • A high level of responsibility, autonomy, and level of impact from day one
  • A competitive package and regular compensation reviews — we reward great work!
  • Annual allowance for personal development
  • Modern work culture: no-meeting Wednesdays, flexibility to work from home, etc.
  • Daily buffet lunch, team events and parties on our roof terrace, gym discount, mobile allowance, amazing free flowers and more.

Apply now

items.content:
Senior Software Engineer

is a fast-growing online-only flower delivery service with a competitive edge. Since launching in 2014, we have become an iconic European flower brand with 110k+ customers with our innovative business model. Our Amsterdam HQ is home to a diverse team of 80+ high-tech and highly-creative people and growing. 

We're looking for a Senior Software Engineer. As part of bloomon’s Product and Engineering team, you’ll build the software that powers our business. From scaling up our subscription platform to meet a 10x increase in volume and complexity to forecasting the number of Paradisaeidae needed for next month’s delivery — you’ll be surprised at the amount of tech in flowers!

What you can expect

  • Shaping our technical platform and engineering culture as we grow
  • Prioritising expertly, communicating clearly, and consistently delivering excellent software engineering skills
  • Juggling multiple responsibilities simultaneously and working across a variety of projects, such as the demands of daily operations, improving the product, innovating the core subscription platform and algorithms, which include order generation, delivery management, invoicing, forecasting, customer data and analytics. 
  • Capability in strong analytics creating innovative operational solutions.
  • Brainstorming with the team to find the best trade-offs between quality, speed, and scope
  • Diligence about improving the codebase
  • Balancing creative engineering with high quality and a customer focus
  • Enhancing working habits and processes that make an effective team: writing good tests, code reviews, writing clear documentation, holding retrospectives, etc
  • Working alongside other developers, product designers, product owners and a broader team of supply chain experts, brand creatives and stylist.

About you 

  • A Bachelor Degree or higher in Computer Science or a related technical field
  • At least 5 years’ professional experience in software development
  • Fluent in 1 or more programming/scripting languages like PHP, Python, Ruby, Javascript…
  • Strong experience with (relational) databases like Postgresql and MySQL
  • Experience of working in an agile environment is a must. Experience in scaling up startups is a bonus.
  • You are an expert in communicating effectively and translating requirements into well-designed technical solutions. 
  • Experience working with large and complex systems
  • Experience with DevOps
  • Experience with part of our current tech stack: 
    • PHP, Laravel
    • React, Node.js
    • Python, Pandas
    • Google Cloud, Kubernetes, Docker
  • You live in the Netherlands/EU
  • Fluent in English. Dutch is a bonus

What we offer

  • A high level of responsibility, autonomy, and level of impact from day one
  • A competitive package and regular compensation reviews — we reward great work!
  • Annual allowance for personal development
  • Modern work culture: no-meeting Wednesdays, flexibility to work from home, etc.
  • Mobile allowance, daily buffet lunch, team events, parties on the roof terrace, gym discount, free flowers and more.

Apply now

items.content:
Senior Full-Stack Developer (JS - Vue.js, PHP - Laravel)

Company: TTEC
Location: Remote
Job type: Full-time
Skills:
  • #laravel
  • #vuejs
  • Accessibility
  • PHP

    • Company description

    Senior Full-stack Developer (JS - Vue.js & PHP - Laravel)

    Job description

    Senior Full-stack Developer (JS - Vue.js & PHP - Laravel)

    ttec, formerly Teletech, is seeking a Sr. Full-stack Developer to join our Product Engineering. This is a nationwide, telecommuting opportunity.

    Why choose TTEC to enhance and broaden your career? We are just as passionate about providing ideal solutions to solving our client’s business problems by driving customer experience outcomes with our enhanced technical capabilities, as you are. Whether you’re the Engineer, Architect, Account Manager, Practice Leader or Sales Executive we need your talent to help us in our exciting journey to success!

    What you’ll be doing:

    As part of our Product Engineering team, you will be a valuable contributor within our icApps group as a Sr. Full-stack Developer. You will work directly with and along side our lead developer and team to identify the design needs of new or modified application features. The Sr. Full-stack Developer will have a seat at the table in all meetings such as project planning, estimation, stand-ups, and stakeholder show & tell.

    • Participate in active discussions regarding new features for future projects.
    • Contribute to the Architecture/Design framework.
    • Help troubleshoot and verify bugs.

    Portal NG Stack

    • Laravel 5.8 - RESTful API
    • Testing: PHPUnit
    • Authentication: Custom, oAuth (Laravel Passport) & JSON Web Tokens
    • Requests: Guzzle
    • Linter/Fixer: php-cs-fixer
    • Vue.js 2.6 - Single Page Application (SPA)
    • Testing: Jest (& expect)
    • Bundler: Webpack
    • Compiler: Babel
    • Styling: Component driven SCSS (using Bootstrap grid)
    • Router: Vue-Router
    • Store: Vuex
    • Request: Axios/Fetch
    • Linter: ESlint
    • Fixer: Prettier
    • Envoy & Bash Scripts - Zero downtime deployment strategy
    • Laravel Dusk - E2E testing framework built on top of ChromeDriver

    What skills you’ll need:

    • 7+ year’s software development experience of web-based applications.
    • The desire to learn while perfecting your craft of designing, building and maintaining enterprise applications.
    • Deep understanding, knowledge and/or experience with most if not all of the following:
    • Test Driven Development (TDD) - preferably using Jest (or Mocha/Jasmine) and PHPUnit
    • Modern Web Languages - HTML, CSS/SCSS, JavaScript/ECMAScript 2015+ (ES6+)
    • JS Frameworks - Vue (or Angular/React)
    • JavaScript build tools - Babel, Webpack, etc.
    • Vue libraries/plugins - vue-test-utils, vue-router, vuex, vue-cli
    • Single Page Applications (SPAs)
    • MVC frameworks - Laravel
    • PHP - all common language features for versions 7.1+
    • Laravel - All features including queues, broadcasting/web sockets (Laravel Echo), Active Record (eloquent), middleware, service providers, database migrations, etc.
    • RESTful APIs
    • API (session-less) authentication - oAuth, JSON Web Tokens, etc
    • Commonly used software design patterns and principles - SOLID, DRY, etc
    • Relational databases, design & best practices - MySQL, PostgreSQL or SQL Server
    • Software development lifecycle - Agile & SCRUM
    • Web Servers - Nginx, Apache, etc
    • Linux Environments - Redhat, CentOS, Ubuntu, etc
    • Experience create accessible and compliant (Section 508 & WCAG A, AA & AAA standards)
    • Ability to do some front-end design allowing for an interactive, accessible and clean UI and UX.
    • Experienced using Test Driven Development (TDD) to produce high-quality, clean code.
    • Some NoSQL database experience and/or knowledge
    • Proficient with SQL and relational database concepts.
    • Highly motivated self-starter with strong attention to detail and proven ability to prioritize and scope work.
    • Excellent logic, problem-solving, and troubleshooting skills.
    • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
    • Ability to work effectively with diverse groups of people.
    • Flexibility to handle demands of a rapidly growing and changing workplace.
    • BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent experience.

    Who We Are:

    TTEC is a pioneer in customer experience, engagement and growth solutions. Our 40,000+ employees serve customers in more than 80 countries and 50 languages across social, mobile, and digital channels. We utilize a holistic approach, applying solutions from our four customer experience segments—Consulting, Technology, Care and Growth—to help companies provide an amazing experience to their customers, inspire customer loyalty, and grow their business. Our employees live by a set of customer-focused values that guide relationships with clients, their customers and each other.

    What We Offer:

    • Variable incentive bonus plan, 401K company match, tuition reimbursement
    • Global career mobility, employee recognition programs, professional development
    • State of the art technology which allows for seamless global connectivity
    • Rich wellness program and health incentives
    Apply now!

items.title: Fullstack Engineer (Remote)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=6, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=13, embedded=0, frontend=9}
items.content:
The Accountancy Cloud are on a mission to reinvent accounting. We offer a unique AI-backed accounting, tax and payroll platform that works like a virtual accountant.

With an amazing team of award winning staff having amassed 7 awards in the past 2 years, we are underpinned with values and people that "dare to do the impossible". We have strong collaboration across the entire team which has proved successful to date with the first employee still with us during the 5 years we've been growing.

Now, we have ambitions to scale our platform and therefore we’re looking for passionate and talented Full Stack Engineers to join us on this journey, fully remote.

Your Responsibilities

  • To build exciting new features in both a back-end and front-end capacity such as our marketplace and SaaS subscription services; and make our platform serve international markets such as the USA; conversational chat-bots as well as various machine learning driven cashflow forecasting tools.

  • To contribute to the future direction and architecture of the product under the guidance of our technical leadership, with the potential to become a leader of the future.

  • To provide a level of business-as-usual support on ongoing platform needs across the business when required.

We’d love you to apply, if

  • You’re a continuous improver, not afraid to take risks, try new things and learn from your mistakes.

  • You are curious and passionate about what you do, you take things apart to learn how they work looking constantly for opportunities to improve.

  • You are more than proficient with PHP and JavaScript, with a penchant for tools and frameworks for Laravel and Vue.js - and have other skills you want to bring to the table.

  • You’re more than just a coder, you think through problems, help clarify requirements and really think about the customer and product first.

  • You know what S.O.L.I.D principles and the ways of the 12-factor app are, and have applied them on real-world projects.

  • You are a systems thinker and a problem solver, you have great instincts and can troubleshooting on unfamiliar projects.

Nice to haves

  • Experience of consuming and building RESTful API’s within the Financial Services space, e.g Xero, QuickBooks, Open Banking etc.

  • Experience developing against, and with, Amazon Web Services.

  • A desire to get involved with AI/Machine Learning and making smarter tools for SME’s

Benefits

  • Flexibility: You can manage your own time, there’s no clock-watching, it’s all about positive outcomes.

  • Culture: A super supportive team, psychological safety and a real desire to develop intrapreneurship within our staff.

  • Founders Programme: Massive development potential to be part of our ‘future founders programme’ was designed to invest in skills with plans and lots of support for your career to flourish.

  • Remote: This role can be fully remote, or in the London office - as long as collaboration, communication and outcomes are met - you control your destiny.

  • Rewards: All the usual suspects including 30 days holiday along with a company pension, a share incentive scheme, corporate discounts, socials and a fun ambitious team.

Location

Your home office? In all seriousness, this role can be fully remote but for times where you want to come to the HQ, we're 10 minutes walk from Old Street underground station in London.

items.title: Web Developer & Data (Intern)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=20, embedded=0, frontend=4}
items.content:
InnovateFromZero.com has a place for a Web Developer (part-time) with working knowledge of Wordpress CMS to develop new skills in web development, design optimisation, data-analytics & technical SEO. As a winner of multiple innovation awards, we help turn great concepts into great products for our clients and often build multiple landing pages as a part of the process.


InnovateFromZero was founded with a vision to help execute product development projects in web, mobile, and IoT. Amongst the founding partners are successful innovators from ex-Nokia, Google, etc.


The position is suited to students or recent graduates who want work experience in Web Development, enjoys designing landing pages, understands SEO and wants to learn more about data-driven development. You want to hone your skills in optimising Wordpress sites, learning about SEO and using Analytics for digital campaigns.


About You: You are self-motivated, likes clean code and want a fast-paced startup experience.


Your Role (needed): • Graduated or due to graduate with a degree in Engineering, IT or IT related subjects or demonstrated professional Development experience. • Wordpress development skills are mandatory


You will assist with:



  • Identify, troubleshoot, fix, and optimize websites for performance

  • Analyze reports to identify trends, issues, areas for opportunity and create actionable plans to improve KPI’s (with support from the team).


BONUS:



  • Good understanding of search performance, conversion, and online data analysis

  • Experience with Wordpress Yoast SEO plug-in

  • Some knowledge of Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, and Google Search Console

  • Excellent HTML, CSS, and JavaScript skills


Data Skills:



  • Data analytics related skills incl use of Kaggle data-sets or kernels

  • Review, update and create high-quality datasets

  • Kernels and tutorials to showcase new features

  • Help onboard client or external partner data-sets

  • Ability to work with messy data and clean, munge, and wrangle it into standard formats using Python or R


Experience working with Data Analytics is not mandatory, but you are a quick learner who can pick up the basics. 


Your Role (preferred): • Some examples of former projects at school/ Uni where you built websites • While some skills can be learned at the job, healthy interest in technology, innovation is useful.


You must have a passion for web development.


To Apply: Send CV/ Letter and tell us why this is right for you! If you have an example of an SEO-optimised website performing well on speed test parameters, etc. you executed in work or uni (is a plus).


If selected you will be based out of our Glasgow city center office in a fantastic co-working environment (2-3 day a week internship, how often you like to come in is flexible, remote work will be OK in some cases).

items.title: Senior Backend Engineer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=29, embedded=0, frontend=14}
items.content:
Senior Backend Engineer

Deeply rooted in all of us are reasons for Why we make the decisions we do. At PracticeGenius we equip thousands of businesses around the globe with tools and services that more effectively engage and align their business goals and initiatives with those of their customers, advocates, and employees. 

By combining the principles of behavioral economics and choice architecture with gamification, reward-loyalty systems, and social engagement functionality we’ve created a scalable platform that helps businesses of all sizes add contextual interactions and incentives to their most valued relationships.

Accomplishing this takes a focused effort from a talented team. Culturally we pride ourselves on the diversity that is celebrated amongst our teams and share an affinity for intelligent minds, quality work, and exceptional customer care. We have employees distributed throughout the US and offer a remote-friendly culture and flexible in-office positions.

Overview

As a Software Engineer at PracticeGenius, you’ll have a significant impact on a product used by millions of users as well as the team behind it. You’ll do this through a combination of writing code, participating in code review, collaborating remotely with engineering and non-engineering team members, and most importantly contributing your own unique experiences and perspective.

Over the last several years we've made significant strides towards improving our tech stack and engineering culture. We are committed to this as a continual journey. Some technologies you'll be working with are: Laravel (primarily JSON REST APIs), MySQL, Elasticsearch, Javascript, React/Redux, webpack, CI (continuous integration), automated testing on both frontend and backend code, automated deployments, AWS, and more.

Join us as we develop fresh new product offerings as well as help drive our continued mission of improving and replacing legacy systems, constantly adopting new technologies in an environment where you are empowered to experiment and free to fail safely.

Who Are You?

  • You care about product, think about end users, and take pride in the quality of your work.
  • Introvert or extrovert, you've got a phenomenal personality and respect for others.
  • You enjoy the constant challenges and learning that come with software development.
  • You’re not afraid to raise concerns, suggest improvements, or question the status quo.
  • You seek to learn from others as well as share your own knowledge and experience.
  • You’re a good and curious person looking to be a big part of a small team.

What Are Your Skills?

  • You are proficient in PHP (Laravel experience is a plus).
  • You are experienced and confident in managing MySQL in production.
  • You communicate effectively whether on video/audio calls or in a chat environment.
  • You can analyze a problem and break it down into small, achievable chunks.
  • You can act on feedback from others and provide helpful feedback to others.
  • You know how to contribute to and work effectively on a distributed, remote team.
  • You know how to research, explore and successfully introduce new technologies.

Examples of profiles that are relevant to us

*You’ve likely had experience that falls into one or more scenarios such as:

  • Led or played a major role in the development of a system involving multiple software developers and/or teams.
  • Held significant ownership of a software project from its early stages, through initial development, to release and maintenance.
  • Revitalized and/or replaced a legacy system with more modern, appropriate technology.
  • Built a sizable authenticated (e.g. OAuth, JWT, etc) RESTful API-based system.
  • Deployed and maintained a load balanced server environment with multiple web-servers.
  • Introduced or owned backend technologies such as ElasticSearch, Memcached, Redis, RabbitMQ, etc.
  • Identified and optimized performance issues on demanding processes, whether they were database or application code oriented.

Compensation and Benefits

  • We offer competitive salaries.
  • We offer several health benefit plans and a company funded FSA.
  • New iMac or Macbook Pro of your choice, monitors, stand up desk, and more…
  • Paid subscriptions/software to help you grow and excel (PhpStorm, Laracasts, egghead.io, Amazon books, etc...)
  • Ample paid time off, flexible work schedule, and a healthy work-life balance.
  • Remote-friendly. Our engineering team is fully distributed across the Western US. USA candidates only please.

We welcome applicants of all backgrounds, gender, age, and race. If you are unsure whether you meet the requirements or have any questions, please reach out and we'd be happy to help!

Well...if this all sounds good to you and you think we might have a fit, please proceed!

Apply now

items.title: Junior WordPress Plugin Developer - UpdraftPlus - Cardiff
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=30, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
UpdraftPlus is Hiring! UpdraftPlus is the world’s most trusted WordPress backup, restore and clone plugin and we are looking for a Junior WordPress Developer to join our growing team.

Our products rely on an amazing user experience and good feedback, which means we need to make sure our plugins and websites are developed and maintained to a very high level. The right candidate will be detail oriented with a passion for helping to create high quality products. This is an opportunity to contribute to popular products used by millions of real users around the world.

This is a permanent position to help develop changes across our catalogue of products and websites. Employment or freelance candidates are both welcome to apply.

Although we do have remote developers, we require this new candidate to work from our office in Cardiff, Wales, UK.

Pay is competitive and will depend on your experience.

What you'll be doing:

  • Working on changes and new features for our catalogue of plugins that will be used be real users around the world
  • Working on changes and new features for our plugin's websites
  • Testing changes to our websites and plugins completed by other developers before they get merged and launched
  • Not just following orders but also thinking outside of the box and trying to break new releases and websites changes to find problems

What we're looking for:

  • PHP – you’d be coding UpdraftPlus or WP Optimize, plus fragments for managing the website, plus UpdraftCentral
  • WordPress plugin development – ideally you’ll have a bit of experience of this, but if not a willingness to learn
  • JavaScript (nice but not necessary) – a smaller part of UpdraftPlus, but much bigger part of UpdraftCentral.
  • GitHub / GitLab / Git – nice to have, but can be learnt quickly by good developers used to alternatives like SVN.
  • Excellent attention to detail
  • Happy to learn new tools and technologies to help complete tasks
  • Comfortable managing your own time (we don't micro-manage!) to make sure tasks are completed within good time.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: £20,000.00 to £24,000.00 /year

Experience:

  • WordPress: 1 year (Preferred)

Location:

  • Cardiff, Cardiff (Required)
Cardiff
Permanent
£20,000 - £24,000 a year

items.content:
Software Developer at Avaaz

Remote | International

Location: Anywhere

Full-time

Allows Remote

Awesome Developers Wanted To Change the World

Avaaz is changing the world, and we’ll give you the means to change it, too. Our team is a place to exercise your creativity and your leadership, while building never-before-seen tools for one of the world’s top online activism organisations. You can let your imagination run wild figuring out how to grow the platform and tools, improve rapid-iterative processes and integrate new technologies.

  • We are a nimble team working on creating opportunities to bring about the world most people everywhere want — one of justice, peace, and freedom.
  • The work environment is quite unique: whether you’re in the office or working from home, our collaborative culture ensures everyone is heard and treated respectfully, with a strong focus on personal development.
  • Our tech build comprises the latest technologies (cloud computing, distributed systems, big data) using great languages (Python, PHP, JS) with proven and cutting-edge datastores (MySQL, Redshift, MongoDB, Redis, Memcache).
  • At Avaaz, your work will have an impact on a huge scale: we have more than 50 million members, who have taken over 200 million actions, told over 500 million friends about Avaaz campaigns and donated more than $50 million online.
  • Our global and distributed tech team creates beautiful, efficient code that works across browsers, platforms and localisations. It’s backed by developers with a proven track record of designing, building and debugging large web applications.

We’re roaming the world in the search for hard-working developers and senior developers with excellent spoken and written communication in English who are able to adapt and learn, with talents for creativity and abstract thinking. The quest is for people who fit that profile; we know specific skills can always be trained and developed.

Let’s chat — I’m pretty sure you’ll want to join us.

Salary is negotiable and tends to be at the top of the NGO space with generous benefits.

Apply for job

items.content:
Backend Engineer at WebDevStudios

Remote | International

We’re searching for a Backend Engineer to join our Engineering team.

Employment type: Full-time

Location: Remote

Do you enjoy to working with the server-side principles of web applications and WordPress themes? Are you enthusiastic to push the web forward, and better yourself? We are also passionate about the web here at WebDevStudios, so let’s chat.

YOUR DAY-TO-DAY

You are primarily responsible for developing and modifying the data layer of WordPress plugins, themes, and web applications according to specifications outlined by the client and defined a Lead Engineer during a Discovery Phase.

Backend Engineers work alongside Frontend Engineers, Project Leads, Project Managers, and other partners during the entire development lifecycle of a project, as well as a supporting the project after it ships.

Technologies you’ll be working with include: PHP7, JavaScript, React, jQuery, Gutenberg, NPM, Gulp, Webpack, Git, Composer, Docker

QUALITIES THAT MATTER TO OUR TEAM:

  • A positive attitude, a good work ethic, and enjoy helping others.
  • Not afraid to ask for help, teachable, a quick study, and have the ability to be flexible when “stuff happens.”
  • Understand deadlines and can complete a variety of tasks throughout the week.
  • Willing to participate in company paid training courses to further their skills.
  • Excited about contributing back to open-source technologies.
  • Comfortable communicating via Slack and participating in video calls with their team while working remotely.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Assist Frontend engineers with the server-side web application data while following WDS Code Standards.
  • Optimize web applications and assets for maximum speed, scalability, and maintainability.
  • Meet documented deadlines and complete tasks in accordance to project milestones.
  • Work directly with Senior or Lead Engineers on feature validation and code reviews.
  • Communicate the status of your work to Project Managers and participate in a project team and department calls.
  • Keep an accurate record of your time with our time tracking software.
  • Be available during normal business hours.
  • Able to work remotely, with a strong emphasis on communication and organizational skills.\

REQUIREMENTS:

  • You have 2+ years professional experience as a Backend Engineer.
  • You have a strong grasp of WordPress plugin and theme structure, template tags, custom post meta, internationalization, and escaping/sanitization of data.
  • You are knowledgeable in writing performant data queries.
  • You have a strong understanding of Git version control and branching strategies.
  • You have a strong comprehension of PHP and object-oriented programming (OOP) practices.
  • Experience with MySQL.
  • Experience JavaScript, React, and jQuery.
  • Experience with accessibility standards.
  • Experience using the terminal/command line.
  • Experience with build tools such as Composer, Webpack and Gulp.

EXTRA CREDIT:

It’s not required, but experience or interest in learning the following would be nice:

  • Automattic’s starter theme, _s or our starter theme, wd_s
  • WebDevStudios plugin generator
  • WordPress plugins like:
    • Advanced Custom Fields
    • Beaver Builder
    • CMB2
    • Gravity Forms
    • Yoast SEO
  • REST APIs, especially the WordPress REST API
  • Gutenberg

ADDITIONAL DETAILS

  • Dress code: pajamas, if you like.
  • This is a full-time, salaried position.
  • Full-time employees enjoy benefits such as Medical/Dental/Vision, Paid Time Off, 401K, and more!
  • Pay rate is based on experience and abilities.
  • Lots and lots of informal GIF sharing.

OH, THE BENEFITS

We know the value in supporting our employees’ holistic well-being, and we make sure our benefits package reflects our commitment to our team.

  • 100% Paid Medical
  • Paid Sick Leave
  • Unlimited Flex Time
  • 25 days paid time off
  • Work from anywhere
  • Employee 401k
  • Continuing Education
  • Parental Leave
  • Annual Company Retreat
Apply for job

tags: DBG:surround``remot 3N OR(options, avail, allow) NOT encourag
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=16, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
Tax Filing Specialist at TaxJar

Remote

REMOTE · United States

DESCRIPTION

TaxJar is the leading technology solution for busy eCommerce sellers to manage sales tax and is trusted by more than 15,000 businesses. Our mission is to make ecommerce easier for everyone.

Our Core Values

  • We do the right thing for our customers.
  • We’re a team, built on trust.
  • We’re proud to be remote.
  • We’re in control of our own destiny.

We have an immediate opening for a hungry, highly-experienced, highly-detail-oriented Tax Filing specialist who is fanatical about helping SMB businesses succeed.

TaxJar is the leading technology solution for busy eCommerce sellers to manage sales tax and is trusted by more than 10,000 businesses. We were founded to help eCommerce owners spend less time on sales tax and more time growing the businesses they love. We’re passionate about creating simple solutions and leveraging technology to solve complicated sales tax issues. We’re not just about sales tax though, we’re a technology-driven company focused on providing a great experience for both merchants and developers. We work closely with eCommerce partners like Amazon, Shopify, eBay, Square, Magento and WooCommerce to help eCommerce businesses thrive.

We offer TaxJar Reports, a simple web-based reporting tool that organizes sales tax data into return-ready reports by state, AutoFile, a service that automatically files sales tax returns (this is the team you’d be joining), and SmartCalcs API, a modern, accurate, sales tax API for developers to outsource sales tax rates and calculations.

*This is a full-time remote position, available to folks located in the continental US only.

As a Tax Filing Specialist you will

  • Interface directly with customers to validate their filing credentials on a per state basis
  • File a high volume of sales tax returns to states (don’t worry, we’ll train you)
  • Work with representatives of states to quickly solve issues related to invalid filings
  • Categorize and quickly respond to customer questions and requests via email
  • Track all customer requests and trending product issues
  • Contribute to clear and simple documentation and support content
  • Work closely with our product team to continually make our filing process more efficient

REQUIREMENTS

You’re the ideal candidate if you

  • Approach success from the customer’s point of view
  • Are extremely patient…sales tax is painful
  • Have impeccible attention to detail
  • Have excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Think the chance to understand the ins-and-outs of sales tax is interesting!
  • Have prior experience handling highly-sensitive data
  • BONUS POINTS if you have previously filed sales tax returns for more than 1 year in multiple states

You’ll be a great fit on our team if you

  • Only want to work remotely
  • Are a PRO at communicating and collaboration
  • Highly value working with people you like and respect
  • Are accountable
  • Are confident in your skills and a solid team player (We’re peers here, no egos please) but also comfortable working asynchronously
  • Hungry to play an impactful role and not afraid to fail

We’re a happy team and we all really love what we do. We’ve created a space where high-achievers can succeed, but are also safe to fail. We’re profitable and focused on growing TaxJar sustainably. We’re always learning how to make TaxJar the best place to work for all of us, and not just another tech startup. We’re always looking for an amazing new teammates to come share in the excitement of solving real-world problems with technology.

BENEFITS

  • Excellent health, vision and dental benefits
  • Flexible vacation policy
  • 401k plan
  • $1,000 in professional development credit
  • Home office stipend
  • Equity in a profitable company
  • 2x year all-company in person retreats (fully paid for by us of course)
  • Mandatory Birthday holiday!
  • 12 week paid maternity/ 6 week paid paternity leave
  • Monthly perks reimbursement for things like Netflix, Amazon Prime, your gym membership, home internet and more

We offer all of our employees amazing benefits. Visit www.TaxJar.com/jobs for a full list of our benefits and to learn more about how we work and what we stand for.

If you’re not the perfect fit for this position, but you know someone who is, we’ll pay you $1,000 if you refer us to the person we hire.

Apply for job

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=5, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=3, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=23, embedded=0, frontend=27}
items.content:
Software Engineer

Developer
Anywhere
Company: Wikimedia Foundation
Full Time

Overview

 Remote

Location:

Summary

Wikimedia projects are built to be collaborative, multilingual and usable by people from around the world. The New Readers Engineering team works on products that deliver compelling experiences to Wikipedia readers in emerging markets, driving increased adoption and retention of Wikipedia.

We are currently working on product intervention explorations that will be gradually rolled out for users later in the year. As a Software Engineer on the team you will be working with Software Engineers, Product Managers, Designers and QA Engineers to develop user interface features, fix bugs, review code and participate in engineering discussions that influence our project decisions. You will be mostly working on PHP, JavaScript, CSS, HTML5.

Our team is fully remote and team members work from various places around the world.

As a Software Engineer, we would like you to do:
  • Follow open source software development discipline when working with the rest of the team such as using bug trackers, version control, review systems, asynchronous communication methods (chat/email) etc.

    • :

    We value
    • Clear and concise communication of complex ideas about software and software development
    • A desire to create features for everyone, everywhere and to optimize at the intersection of performance and user perception
    • Comfortable working in a multi-cultural, remote, distributed team across various time zones
    • An interest in working with legacy software and modernizing code
    • Instrumenting new and core features and maintaining a set of key performance indicators

      • Requirements
      • Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science or STEM field; or equivalent professional experience
      • 3-5+ years related professional experience
      • knowledge in PHP, JavaScript, HTML5, CSS, and modern web standards is a must.
      • Knowledge of developing and debugging in Linux/Unix (LAMP) environments.
      • Interest in focused software engineering: you enjoy writing unit tests, reviewing code and responding to code reviews, and discussing architectural approach
      • Passionate about free knowledge and open source
      • Willing to travel occasionally – sometimes internationally – for team and organizational meetings

        • Plus
        • Familiarity with JS libraries like jQuery
        • Familiarity with open source software development processes
        • Experience of working in open source project communities
        • Knowledge about internationalization
        • Experience of presenting your work at conferences or tech talks.
        • Working knowledge of a language other than English would be valuable

          • We’d like to see your work!  Here are a few things you’ll need:
          • If you have any existing open source software that you’ve developed (these could be your own software or patches to other packages), please share the URLs for the source. Links to your projects on GitHub, GitLab, BitBucket, etc. are exceptionally useful.

            • The Wikimedia Foundation is… 

            …the nonprofit organization that hosts and operates Wikipedia and the other Wikimedia free knowledge projects. Our vision is a world in which every single human can freely share in the sum of all knowledge. We believe that everyone has the potential to contribute something to our shared knowledge, and that everyone should be able to access that knowledge, free of interference. We host the Wikimedia projects, build software experiences for reading, contributing, and sharing Wikimedia content, support the volunteer communities and partners who make Wikimedia possible, and advocate for policies that enable Wikimedia and free knowledge to thrive. The Wikimedia Foundation is a charitable, not-for-profit organization that relies on donations. We receive financial support from millions of individuals around the world, with an average donation of about $15. We also receive donations through institutional grants and gifts. The Wikimedia Foundation is a United States 501(c)(3) tax-exempt organization with offices in San Francisco, California, USA.

            The Wikimedia Foundation is an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage people with a diverse range of backgrounds to apply.

            U.S. Benefits & Perks*
            • Fully paid medical, dental and vision coverage for employees and their eligible families (yes, fully paid premiums!)
            • The Wellness Program provides reimbursement for mind, body and soul activities such as fitness memberships, baby sitting, continuing education and much more
            • The 401(k) retirement plan offers matched contributions at 4% of annual salary
            • Flexible and generous time off – vacation, sick and volunteer days, plus 19 paid holidays – including the last week of the year.
            • Family friendly! 100% paid new parent leave for seven weeks plus an additional five weeks for pregnancy, flexible options to phase back in after leave, fully equipped lactation room.
            • For those emergency moments – long and short term disability, life insurance (2x salary) and an employee assistance program
            • Pre-tax savings plans for health care, child care, elder care, public transportation and parking expenses
            • Telecommuting and flexible work schedules available
            • Appropriate fuel for thinking and coding (aka, a pantry full of treats) and monthly massages to help staff relax
            • Great colleagues – diverse staff and contractors speaking dozens of languages from around the world, fantastic intellectual discourse, mission-driven and intensely passionate people

              • *Eligible international workers’ benefits are specific to their location and dependent on their employer of record

              More information

              WMF
              Blog
              Wikimedia 2030
              Wikimedia Medium Term Plan
              Diversity and inclusion information for Wikimedia workers, by the numbers
              Wikimania 2019
              Annual Report – 2017 
              Apply for job

items.content:
TTEC is seeking a Sr. Full-stack
Developer to join our Product Engineering team. This is a nationwide,
telecommuting opportunity.???

Why choose TTEC to enhance and
broaden your career? ?We are just as passionate about providing ideal
solutions to solving our client?s business problems by driving customer
experience outcomes with our enhanced technical capabilities, as you are. ?Whether
you?re the Engineer, Architect, Account Manager, Practice Leader or Sales
Executive we need your talent to help us in our exciting journey to
success!?

What you?ll be doing:???

As part of our Product Engineering
team, you will be a valuable contributor within our Humanify group as a Sr.
Full-stack Developer. You will work directly with and along-side our lead
developer and team to identify the design needs of new or modified application
features. The Sr. Full-stack Developer will have a seat at the table in all
meetings such as project planning, estimation, stand-ups, and stakeholder show
& tell.?
  • Participate in active discussions regarding new
    features for future projects.
  • Contribute to the Architecture/Design framework.
  • Help troubleshoot and verify bugs.
Portal NG Stack??
  • Laravel 5.8 - RESTful API
    • Testing: PHPUnit
    • Authentication: Custom, oAuth
      (Laravel Passport) & JSON Web Tokens
    • Requests: Guzzle
    • Linter/Fixer: php-cs-fixer
  • Vue.js 2.6 - Single Page Application (SPA)?
    • Testing: Jest (& expect)
    • Bundler: Webpack
    • Compiler: Babel
    • Styling: Component driven SCSS
      (using Bootstrap grid)
    • Router: Vue-Router
    • Store: Vuex
    • Request: Axios/Fetch
    • Linter: ESlint
    • Fixer: Prettier
  • Envoy & Bash Scripts - Zero downtime deployment
    strategy
  • Laravel Dusk - E2E testing framework built on top of
    ChromeDriver
What skills you?ll need:?
  • 7+ year?s software development experience of web-based
    applications.
  • The desire to learn while perfecting your craft of
    designing, building and maintaining enterprise applications.
  • Deep understanding, knowledge and/or experience with
    most if not all of the following:
    • Test Driven Development (TDD)
      - preferably using Jest (or Mocha/Jasmine) and PHPUnit
    • Modern Web Languages -
      ?HTML, CSS/SCSS, JavaScript/ECMAScript 2015+ (ES6+)
    • JS Frameworks - Vue (or Angular/React)
    • JavaScript build tools -
      Babel, Webpack, etc.
    • Vue libraries/plugins -
      vue-test-utils, vue-router, vuex, vue-cli
    • Single Page Applications
      (SPAs)
    • MVC frameworks - Laravel
    • PHP - all common language
      features for versions 7.1+
    • Laravel - All features
      including queues, broadcasting/web sockets (Laravel Echo), Active Record
      (eloquent), middleware, service providers, database migrations, etc.
    • RESTful APIs
    • API (session-less)
      authentication - oAuth, JSON Web Tokens, etc
    • Commonly used software design
      patterns and principles - SOLID, DRY, etc
    • Relational databases, design
      & best practices - MySQL, PostgreSQL or SQL Server
    • Software development lifecycle
      - Agile & SCRUM
    • Web Servers - Nginx, Apache,
      etc
    • Linux Environments - Redhat,
      CentOS, Ubuntu, etc
  • Experience creating accessible and compliant apps (Sec
    508 & WCAG A, AA & AAA standards)
  • Ability to do some front-end design allowing for an
    interactive, accessible and clean UI and UX.
  • Experienced using Test Driven Development (TDD) to
    produce high-quality, clean code.
  • Some NoSQL database experience and/or knowledge?
  • Proficient with SQL and relational database concepts.
  • Highly motivated self-starter with strong attention to
    detail and proven ability to prioritize and scope work.
  • Excellent logic, problem-solving, and troubleshooting
    skills.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Ability to work effectively with diverse groups of
    people.
  • Flexibility to handle demands of a rapidly growing and
    changing workplace.
  • BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent experience.?
Who We Are:?

TTEC is a pioneer in customer
experience, engagement and growth solutions. Our 40,000+ employees serve
customers in more than 80 countries and 50 languages across social, mobile, and
digital channels. ? We utilize a holistic approach, applying solutions from
our four customer experience segments?Consulting, Technology, Care and
Growth?to help companies provide an amazing experience to their customers,
inspire customer loyalty, and grow their business. Our employees live by a set
of customer-focused values that guide relationships with clients, their
customers and each other.?

What We Offer:
  • Variable incentive bonus plan, 401K company match,
    tuition reimbursement
  • Global career mobility, employee recognition programs,
    professional development
  • State of the art technology which allows for seamless
    global connectivity
  • Rich wellness program and health incentives

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=28, embedded=0, frontend=8}
items.content:
Signkick

 

Senior Back-end Engineer, PHP

verified
+- 2 hours time difference from Amsterdam / CET
**About us**
We’re Signkick, a pioneering Adtech company on a mission to revolutionise an industry. Our flagship product, Signkick Trading Bridge, is designed to connect Out-of-Home (that’s billboards, bus stops and other advertising outside of our homes) media owners with buyers and brands looking to advertise. But our mission doesn’t stop there. We’re automating this connection to help them deliver more dynamic, creative and efficient advertising than ever before. Innovative stuff for an industry still handling bookings via spreadsheets and phone calls.

For our R&D team based in Amsterdam, that means building and connecting APIs, setting standards, dealing with high-throughput and large datasets – all with smart processing. We then top it off with seriously slick UI which allows clients to manage campaigns, configure their connections and analyse trading.

The next part of our tech offering is Console, an e-commerce solution that lets media owners sell direct to advertisers.

By joining our tight-knit team you’ll be integral to developing and delivering this product as it continues to evolve. We move fast for our clients through smart use of the latest technologies, We care about quality and doing things right from the beginning.

If you want to work with complex distributed systems at the forefront of technological development alongside an internationally diverse team with a passion for software development submit your interest and let’s talk.

**Things we value**
Passion, freedom and responsibility. Loyalty, trust and transparency. But above all, we want good people who dream big!

# Responsibilities
As Senior Back-end Engineer, you’ll form an integral part of Signkick’s core development team. This team is responsible for all aspects of our software development including requirement engineering, the CI/CD pipeline, QA tooling set-up and processes and, of course, building great software and getting it live.

Working directly with the CTO/co-founder and the product owner you’ll build new features that empower our customers, improve the scalability and reliability of our products. You’ll build integrations with our customer and supplier systems as well as the integrations with media players that power digital billboards. You’ll see your work in action in the real world. We’re growing fast too, so you’ll also help with setting standards and scaling our development process across the board.

# Requirements
**What skills do you need?**
Proven working experience with most of the following (or similar): PHP 7+, Symfony 3/4, Doctrine, MySQL 5.7+, MongoDB 4+, GraphQL, RabbitMQ
Experience with Kubernetes and Docker

**You have…**
An uncontrollable urge to write clean and well-designed code
3+ years of software development experience with PHP
A love of working in a lean and agile environment
The drive to take ownership of a project from start to finish
The ability to learn quickly
No time for ‘Not Invented Here’ syndrome
An affinity with our core values
A good understanding of English (written and spoken)

**It helps if you have…**
Previously worked in a high-growth environment
A BS/MS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related subject
Experience with Elasticsearch and Kibana
Experience with architectural patterns like DDD, CQRS and hexagonal architecture
Experience with ESB systems (WSO2 or likewise) and Angular 2+



#Salary
$70,000


#Location
- +- 2 hours time difference from Amsterdam / CET

items.content:
Curotec

Senior Magento Developer


We are looking for a highly skilled developer that has experience in building complex E-commerce websites using the Magento 2 framework. The position is for a full-time contract with the option to convert to a full-time employee at the end. Candidates should have experience dealing with standard and custom extension development, security, payment integration, ERP and MA integration as well as custom pricing and multilingual sites.

We are expecting this position to be a remote one, however, our office is based in Wayne, PA USA.





Job Requirements

- Must be able to work EDT business hours. 8am - 5pm New York time.

- Must be able to speak and write fluent English. Your first interview will be a video call via Skype.

 - Must be dedicated, passionate and hard-working. Attitude is everything.

- Must be able to work with a team and collaborate remotely. Hard workers and self-starters please apply.



Technical Requirements:

- Must have experience with PHP, Magento, Javascript, HTML5, CSS3.

- Must have experience with system integrations and custom extension development.

- Experience with M1 to M2 migrations a plus

- Theme customization, frontend experience

- Experience in Payment/Shipping method development
- Experience in Custom extension development / Core feature customization

- Able to work with Adobe PSD files

- Magento Certifications a plus





Please list your skills and experience with each framework you know as well as your ability to work with others and meet deadlines. We are looking for more than just, “I can do xyz tasks”. We are looking for a thoughtful response as to why you are a good candidate for this job.

Our Hiring Process

We have a 2-part hiring process that includes a written code test and then a video interview.


* Code Test
In order to qualify for the position, you must pass a code test that takes 2 - 4 hours to complete.





* Video Interview
Verbal technical interview and then personal interview.

Apply now

About Curotec

We have a really interesting team of people that span many different skill sets, cultures and backgrounds. We are a melting pot of sorts. One of the things our team members enjoy the most about working at Curotec is their ability to learn new things every day, not only about technology but also about their fellow team members and their cultures.

Testimonials from our team:

"I really like the work culture and ethics followed at Curotec. They give you the required ownership and freedom to complete the work. Management is really cooperative and friendly. Curotec is a highly recommended workplace for anyone!"

"Real job but working from home or any place gives freedom and peace. Working with Professional teams and good projects gives head start to mid-level developers."

“I am very grateful for the opportunity Curotec has given me to discover my hidden skills and gain experience in the industry. I am happy to work on the team in a growing company environment."

Our Process:

At Curotec, we are not your typical web development company. Our focus leans heavily on user experience and also maintaining a cutting-edge approach to our design and development for enterprise-level solutions.

items.title: Software Developer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=6, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=29, embedded=0, frontend=30}
items.content:
About Tutorful

Founded in 2015, Tutorful is a tech start-up situated in the heart of Sheffield. Our vision and mission is to make tutoring affordable and accessible to all. We now have over 10,000 tutors across the UK delivering over 10,000 lessons per week, both in person and online. Our revolutionary approach to tutoring and our fantastic growth have helped us become recognised as one of the top 100 startups in the UK.

We’re building a stellar team to help us achieve our goal. We strive to create an environment where you can do your best work - our people are empowered to make the bold decisions others wouldn’t, and make a genuine impact on the lives of thousands of young learners. Join us, and you’ll be challenged and supported in equal measure.

The role
We are looking for a full stack developer who can help define and build the customer-facing side of our business. The role will include:
Joining a small, autonomous, agile team using modern web development methodologies such as continuous delivery.
Working with your team to come up with ideas and define the backlog, with the aim of solving real customer problems.
Bringing new features to life, from initial design through to writing well structured modular code, automated tests, and deployment.
Working closely with other teams around the office, including product managers, marketing and customer support.

What we’re looking for
We don’t have an ideal candidate, and aptitude and a willingness to learn are just as important than qualifications or experience. With that said, having familiarity with some of the technologies and methodologies below would be beneficial:
Prior experience and success building products as a full stack developer.
Knowledge of PHP 7, and a modern framework such as Laravel or Symfony.
Experience building and using scalable APIs.
Familiarity with modern devops, including deployment pipelines.
Fluency with at least one major Javascript framework (ideally Vue, but experience in React or Angular would also be applicable).
An understanding of scalable frontend architecture.
Familiarity with modern tooling such as Grunt/Gulp, Webpack, Docker, Git etc.

If you have skills that align with this role and you could contribute to our goals but your experience or salary expectations don't match what we're offering, don't be put off. We look for the right people and we are flexible, so we'd still encourage applications from strong candidates.

Benefits:
Some of our benefits include:
25 days holiday, with an extra day for each year you are with us (up to 28).
An additional 5 days holiday through salary sacrifice.
Genuinely flexible working, with remote working on Wednesdays.
A great office environment, including free fruit, beer on Thursday afternoons, and regular company-organised socials.
Regular conference opportunities and a dedicated training budget.
A generous equity scheme for senior employees.

Please send CV’s if you feel you would be a good fit for this role. We look forward to hearing from you.

items.content:
Software Engineer - Leading Applications Consultancy Services

Flexible / Remote Working Opportunity!

PHP / Linux / MySQL / Apache / HTML / CSS /JavaScript

We are seeking a technical Software Engineer, skilled in the LAMP stack PHP, Linux, MySQL and Apache, to work within an established technology, development and consultancy team in the central Southampton area. This is a unique opportunity to join a growing software solutions and services company.

Our client are an expanding and successful consultancy services and applications technology firm and they are looking to recruit a dedicated software / web engineer to join the team based in Southampton. They have begun expanding their internal development to develop the next phase of their software platform and various applications.

As a PHP Engineer you will work on delivering a number of applications working through the full project lifecycle from analysis and specification through to development, testing and release.

The position is suited to a Developer or Engineer who is keen to work in a dynamic and vibrant business, someone who has a can-do attitude and someone who is looking to make the role their own.

Suitable candidates should possess:

PHP (ideally PHP5 and 7v)
LAMP
MySQL
Linux
Apache
MVC Laravel
Drupal
Have a working knowledge and up to date with HTML / CSS and JavaScript technologiesMy client is able to offer an attractive salary, benefits package and are also able to offer flexible and remote working options.

If you would like to be considered for this opportunity then please send your CV to (url removed) or call (phone number removed) if you wish to be considered for this position

items.content:
Happiness Engineer (UK Only) at Flywheel

Remote
Happiness Engineer (UK Only)

SUPPORT DEPARTMENT | UNITED KINGDOM

Join the team and help us build something incredible!

You’ll be responsible for understanding customers’ needs, communicating solutions, solving problems, and working with an incredibly talented team to help our customers succeed. We provide support for a wide variety of topics ranging from hosting help and development dilemmas to recommending articles to read or sharing pictures of our cats. (Yep – that’s a true story!)

If you love working with people, enjoy a challenge, and know the right moment to add your favorite gif to an email, we’d love to hear from you!

Think you’re a perfect fit?

Here’s just a little taste of what we’re looking for

OUR IDEA OF A PERFECT CANDIDATE IS SOMEONE WHO…
  • Has a desire to help people, and a strong sense of empathy for their needs
  • Is genuinely a nice human
  • Holds technical knowledge – You’re comfortable with the command line/general internet infrastructure (DNS / SFTP Linux, etc.), and you’re excited at the prospect of using the latest technology
  • Has a willingness to learn new things, and an aptitude for technology
  • Has excellent written English – Both short form (emails/chats) and long form (documentation)
  • Is authorized to live and work in the United Kingdom (UK)
  • Is willing and able to travel to the United States for training and all company retreats
  • Is willing and able to work the Saturday-Wednesday shift
THIS ROLE WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR…
  • Responding to email tickets, online chat or phone calls to help Flywheel customers with their website issues
  • Helping to write excellent help documentation – both for internal use and for our customers
  • Helping customers migrate their sites to Flywheel
  • Debugging and troubleshooting technical problems
  • Working the Saturday-Wednesday shift

Flywheel’s customers are some of the top designers and agencies in the world, and they build beautiful, amazing websites with WordPress. The job of the support team (and everyone at Flywheel) is to help them focus on doing what they love – and leave the hosting to us. If you’ve built WordPress sites (or are eager to learn), love solving problems for people, and are ready to join a fast-growing company, we’d love to hear from you.

Location: United Kingdom Only

Apply for job

items.content:
Senior Engineer - Backend (WordPress)

Do you enjoy to working with the server-side principles of web applications and WordPress themes? Are you enthusiastic to push the web forward, and better yourself? We are also passionate about the web here at WebDevStudios, so let’s chat.

You are primarily responsible for developing and modifying the data layer of WordPress plugins, themes, and web applications according to specifications outlined by the client and defined our Strategy team during a discovery phase.

Backend Engineers work alongside Frontend Engineers, Project Leads, Project Managers, and other partners during the entire development lifecycle of a project, as well as a supporting the project after it ships.

Technologies you’ll be working with include: PHP7, JavaScript, React, jQuery, Gutenberg, NPM, Gulp, Webpack, Git, Composer, Docker

RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Assist Frontend engineers with the server-side web application data while following WDS Code Standards.
  • Optimize web applications and assets for maximum speed, scalability, and maintainability.
  • Meet documented deadlines and complete tasks in accordance to project milestones.
  • Work directly with Senior or Lead Engineers on feature validation and code reviews.
  • Communicate the status of your work to Project Managers and participate in a project team and department calls.
  • Keep an accurate record of your time with our time tracking software.
  • Be available during normal business hours.
  • Able to work remotely, with a strong emphasis on communication and organizational skills.

REQUIREMENTS:
  • You have 2+ years professional experience as a Backend Engineer.
  • You have a strong grasp of WordPress plugin and theme structure, template tags, custom post meta, internationalization, and escaping/sanitization of data.
  • You are knowledgeable in writing performant data queries.
  • You have a strong understanding of Git version control and branching strategies.
  • You have a strong comprehension of PHP and object-oriented programming (OOP) practices.
  • Experience with MySQL.
  • Experience JavaScript, React, and jQuery.
  • Experience with accessibility standards.
  • Experience using the terminal/command line.
  • Experience with build tools such as Composer, Webpack and Gulp.

QUALITIES THAT MATTER TO OUR TEAM:
  • A positive attitude, a good work ethic, and enjoy helping others.
  • Not afraid to ask for help, teachable, a quick study, and have the ability to be flexible when “stuff happens.”
  • Understand deadlines and can complete a variety of tasks throughout the week.
  • Willing to participate in company paid training courses to further their skills.
  • Excited about contributing back to open-source technologies.
  • Comfortable communicating via Slack and participating in video calls with their team while working remotely.

BENEFITS:
  • 100% paid health/dental/vision
  • Generous paid time off
  • Unlimited Flex time
  • Paid sick leave
  • Company 401k
  • Parental Leave
  • Continuing Education

items.content:
We have a tremendous opportunity for a Remote Software Developer with our leading national security client in Herndon.
Due to federal security contract requirements, applicant must be a US Citizen.
Responsibilities of the Software Developer:
  • Design and develop software solutions
  • Perform and document unit tests according to requirements
  • Maintain existing application software in configuration management repository
  • Document software release procedures and contribute to software release in test and production
Requirements of the Software Developer:
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent
  • At least 7 years of experience using PHP and JavaScript to develop portal and web applications
  • Ability to integrate third party applications into existing development framework
  • Clear and effective verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively
Keywords: Software Developer, PHP, JavaScript, National Security
Job ID: 321157
About Eliassen Group:
Eliassen Group provides strategic talent solutions to drive our clients? innovation and business results. Leveraging over 30 years of success, our expertise in IT staffing, Agile consulting, creative services, managed services, and life sciences enables us to partner with our clients to execute their business strategy and scale effectively. Headquartered in Reading, MA and with offices from coast to coast, Eliassen Group offers local community presence, deep networks, as well as national reach. For more information, visit .
Eliassen Group is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.
Don?t miss out on our referral program! If we hire a candidate that you refer us to then you can be eligible for a $1,000 referral check !
